intro: Helichrysum obconicum, commonly known as the golden marguerite or everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its densely packed, yellow-orange flower heads that resemble daisies, which are composed of numerous small, tubular florets. The plant produces bracts that are often mistaken for petals, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flowers. Helichrysum obconicum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
